ygData.subject: Re: LOOK AT THIS VERY IMPORTANT SERIOUS
ygData.msgSnippet: Paladins got bows about a month or so ago.  I suppose a group of paladins got together and /petitioned to have some way to attack us SK s at a distance and got
ygData.messageBody:
Paladins got bows about a month or so ago. I suppose a group of paladins
got together and /petitioned to have some way to attack us SK's at a
distance and got what they wanted, I don't know. But your point about
paladins supposedly being honorable enough NOT to use a bow, is a good one
even if it is (dare I say it?) role playing more than anything else. A good
majority of paladin's players out there are not really playing paladins as
they are playing warriors with spellcasting abilities. The same rings true
for many SK players. I will not get into the role-play/powergame debate
here, but suffice it to say, a lot of things fall by the wayside once people
start to play.

Drakhan of Solusek Ro

----- Original Message -----
From: Damon Grimfiend <grimfiend_loa@...>
To: <eq_shadowknights@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, June 28, 1999 1:28 AM
Subject: Re: [eq_shadowknights] LOOK AT THIS VERY IMPORTANT SERIOUS


> From: Damon Grimfiend <grimfiend_loa@...>
>
> Maybe I was wrong in my previous post, but when did paladins get bows? I
> haven't really been playing everquest because I have been bored of it, but
> last I knew the general attitude of the paladin was that ranged combat was
> dishonorable(description of the paladin on everquest page) and they could
> not use the archery skill let alone any bows.
